https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/70135/ : SUCCESS
I don't see a purpose in adding PLDM here in the name. This will actually be picked up by bmcweb as well.
This is the proposal template of sensor name if sensor auxiliary names PDRs is not available.(https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/docs/+/47252/18/designs/pldm-stack.md#374)
Ack
What populated sensorName?
The sensor name is from sensor auxiliary names PDR or default sensor name if sensor auxiliary names PDR is not found.
Ack
Also need to set inventory association (question is also how do we determine the associated inventory object). See https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/Utils.cpp#L510.

Based on my understanding from the below two descriptions, ObjectMapper just needs one of sensor or inventory object having associationDefinition D-Bus interface to create forward and reverse association.

https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/sensor-architecture.md#association-names
https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/object-mapper.md#associations

The device can have IPMI FRU or PLDM FRU(PLDM type 4). Based on which inventory needs to be created and associated.
So the actual queries are
1. How inventory objects are getting created?
2. How PLDM will get to know the inventory object path to which association needs to be created?
3. Let's take the usecase of an add in card. How it will be represented in redfish(as a seperate chassis?) and list the sensors?

In this patchset, An inventory object is created for each terminus to the path /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/Item/Board/PLDM_Device_<TID> at line15 of terminus.cpp and all the sensors found in PDRs will be associated to it.

It is planed to have another patch set to update sensor's associations D-Bus interface according to the information from association PDRs and smbios-mdr.

I like understand more on how the data from smbios-mdr will be used to create inventory. May be i will wait for the patch or a small write up could help.

Also, in this case do you have an onboard PLDM device or is it behind a PCIe slot?
Please init PODs on stack.
Ack
Why not use the pdr fields from libpldm as is?
Ack
Can we have this inherit sdbusplus object like elsewhere so that constructing this makes the D-Bus object?
Ack
Please add documentation.
Ack
Please add documentation.
Ack
Should be configurable.
Ack
Are we ignoring all of these fields?
Ack
What are the pointer increments helping with?
Ack
Need to add unit tests.
Ack
We need concern about the way to handle multiple of sensor PDRs types in sensorManager. Because beside NumericSensorPDRs, we also have EffecterPDRs, CompactNumericPDRs.

As my opinion, the code to create the sensor D-Bus object, updating the value, functional properties of this object should implement in the other class. May be name pldmDBusSensor.
Dbus sensor class should independence with the PLDM interface. NumericSensor class will call pldm command to get the sensor value. It then call updateReading in pldmDBusSensor to update the dbus, the pldmDBusSensor class can check the threshold to create the sel log if need.
pldmDBusSensor will be similar as phosphor-hwmon or dbus-sensors.

Thanks for the comment. My idea is keeping the patch set as small as possible for current patch set and I think it will be good to refine the classes when implementing other types of PLDM sensor/effecter.

Are we supporting asych event generation from the sensor ?
and the ability to enable and disable this event generation (SetNumericSensorEnable)
It is not in current plan due to lack of hardware for developing and testing.
Ack
This function is used to update the value of NumericSensor. The function name should include the sensor type.

The function name is named for matching the name used in DSP0248 18.2 GetSensorReading Command.
For state sensor, the corresponding function name will be sendGetStateSensorReadings() for matching the name, GetStateSensorReadings, which is defined in the DSP0248 20.2
Ack
The function name should be updated also.
It is for matching the name defined in DSP0248 18.2
Ack

This will cause the BMC sends a lot of GetSensorReading commands in parallel.
It is a violation of 6.3.2 of DSP0240

> This will cause the BMC sends a lot of GetSensorReading commands in parallel.
> It is a violation of 6.3.2 of DSP0240
Is it a typo? Do you mean 7.3.2 of DSP0240, Requirements for requesters. Yes, it is a issue if there are more than one sensor in the same terminus. Please review the code change in patchset15. The command is sent by Coroutine to avoid send multiple command in parallel.
Yes, it's Requirements for requesters. I referred to an older version(1.0.0). The patchset15 solved it.
The decode_get_sensor_reading_resp() will return PLDM_ERROR_INVALID_LENGTH if the sensorDataSize is smaller than response's. sensorDataSize should be initialized as the expected size.
Ack

If somehow we have the same sensorName from different PDRs, it generates an exception when creating the NumericSensor: sd_bus_add_object_vtable: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.FileExists: File exists
we have to handle the situation.

I thought that the all sensor names in the same terminus should be different. So the sensor Id still should be part of D-Bus object path to handle this situation. Please find the code change in patchset15.
Yes, the sensor ID should be unique in a terminus, but if we do not catch the exception, incorrect PDRs(duplicated sensor ID) from a terminus might terminate the whole pldmd.
Ack
Where is the startSensorPolling() called in normal initialization?
It should be called by terminusManager in discoverTermunsTask(). This part of code somehow missed during rebasing. Thanks for the catch and sorry for the mistake.
Ack
The completionCode should be checked before using any other data. If the CC is not success, other data might be invalid.
Ack

warnings: variable ‘co’ set but not used
What's the purpose of this variable?

The purpose was for destroying the coroutine when it is done. But it is unnecessary and doesn't work as expected because coroutine destroys itself when coroutine reaches the co_return statement.
Added inSensorPolling flag checking for avoiding to start multiple doSensorPollingTask() Coroutine in new patch set.
Ack
We don't update pdr in side NumericSensor. I don't think we need share pointer.
numericSensor class doesn't keep the pdr as member variable now. The pdr is just for initializing member variables in constructor.
How above init minValue, maxValue to std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() as you do for threshold?
Ack
The default value should be NAN I think.
Ack
Pldm-stack details that sensor_name = sensorAuxName + TID# I think.

The change was for avoiding duplicated sensor name if there are the same string to multiple aux sensor name PDRs. It is reverted to sensorAuxName + TID# now because the case is handled by the try and catch block now.
typo.
Ack
Please add a safety check here. After the regex the result should not be just underscores. It is possible if some one connects a PLDM device whose name language tag is not English.

Fixed by using default sensor name if aux sensor name language tag is not "en" 
in Terminus::addNumericSensor() at line 487 of terminus.cpp

May i know what is the reason behind this multiplication.
Also, note that the pdr field having type as real32 can support value "Unknown", 'infinite' etc.. We should be able to check/support those as well.

The multiplication is fixed by patchset 35 to 10000000 to convert second to microsecond.

Does "unknown" in the description of DSP0248 means NaN? How do we ensure the value of NaN in between two PLDM terminus are equal since the float NaN and infinity are implementation defined.

I wasn't able to find an exact line in spec which say it, but I believe by value "Unknown" they mean NaN.

Coming to the implementation side of it, as per DSP0248 update_interval is real32. And DSP0240 defines how to represent NaN for real32. As long as all the devices stick to it, all terminus will have same implementation.

Fixed.
If update_interval is NaN, UpdateTime is assigned to 0.
The polling loop skips sensor when its updateTime is 0.

Fixed again.
If update_interval is NaN, UpdateTime is assigned to std::numeric_limits<unit64_t>::max().
The polling loop skips sensor when its updateTime is max.
Note:- Resolution can have NaN value.

Added std::isnan() checking. If resolution is NaN then use 1.0 instead.

But I have question here since the value of resolution is from PDR and the NaN of float and double are implementation-defined. How does PLDM terminus side know what value is interpreted by BMC as NaN?
Not exactly. Resolution is of type real32. So NaN will be represented in the same format as defined for real32(DSP0240).
Fixed by adding NaN check.
do we need similar NaN check for thresholdWarningIntf at L291 as well?

I didn't add NaN check for thresholdWarningIntf because of description of rangeFieldSupport in Table 102 of DSP0248 v1.2.1. It says that warningHigh and warningLow fields are always supported.

I think the definitions of supportedThresholds and rangeFieldSupport are not aligned. The supportedThsholds field says that warning thresholds can be optional but rangeFieldSupport doesn't.

I suppose you are refering to table 78. Table 102 is compact sensor.
And you are right, the spec itself callout(table 78, rangeFieldSupport definition) that it is an error in original specification and will be corrected in next major release.

I dont have a strong opinion but to be on the safer side since the data type can support NaN, may be we can add the NaN check.
Fixed by adding NaN check.
nit: please avoid magic numbers for easy understanding.
Ack
Mark WIP due to the cross-repo dependency https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/59033
Should we use supportedThresholds value to identify the existing of warningLow/WarningHigh threshold?
No checking for WarningLow/WarningHigh threshold is because the range_field_support  (table 78 of DSP0248 v1.2.2) doesn't define the bits for warningHigh/Low thresholds .

This piece of codes will be duplicated when supporting more PDRs like CompactNumericSensor, CompactNumericEffecter, ...
Should we move these codes to a common library so that other can use?

The numeric_sensor class support both numeric sensor PDR and compact numeric sensor PDR now.
Will consider if the code needs refinement when supporting numeric effecter PDR and compact numeric effecter PDR.
same as above

BMC can manage sensor threshold and check for threshold violation. It can also support threshold via sensor events. Should we have option for users to disable threshold check when they want to have threshold events from sensor events?
Will be addressed by the patch-set to add event handling support.
Beside polling sensors, manager should also polling events, errors so the "error" string should be removed from the function name. The same comments for startSensorPolling function.

Using only one timer to poll all sensors of all terminus can cause the delay in updating value of one sensor. In some systems, the temperature sensors can be used for thermal control and they should be updated per second or event less.
Moreover, stop polling all sensors of all terminus when one terminus is added/removed is not reasonable. Changing on one terminus should only affect on its' side.
I suggest to move polling timer to terminus class, so each terminus will manage its' sensors/effecter independently.
each terminus has its owner timer and coroutine in the patch set 54 to reduce the delay in updating sensor reading if BMC manages multiple termini.

Beside numericSensor we also have to support others sensor types such as compact numeric sensors. So add abstract sensor interface is required. This help reusing the common functions such as conversionFormula(), unitModifier(), checkThreshold().
I think we can use default Per_second polling rate for "No Occurrence Rate"

We should only stop the added/removed terminus.
The others terminus should keep polling.
The value of sensor should be NAN when it is disabled or Unavailable.
